result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF1011, 14CF1086 and 15CF247 called: 10:21am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to:
15CF247>>D&RI entire file
14CF1086>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
14CF1011 - Ct. 1 (Poss w/Intent/THC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 3 years Probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof - for any week that status is not held, defendant must perform 10 hours of c.s./week; Absolute sobriety; 20 days MCJ w/credit for 29 days of time already served.

Argument by counsel on defendant request to petition for expungement if probation completed successfully; COURT makes findings - COURT allows expungement after the successful completion of probation.
Defendant requests any property that is not contraband be returned to him - 2 phones and $100 of cash; COURT enters order consistent with plan that State has placed on record.

Adj: 10:45am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
